oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Union Gen. William P. Sanders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This image came from the photographic album of Col. Orlando Poe, who went to West Point with Sanders and wrote on the back of the cdv "Genl. Wm. P. Sanders July 1863, Died Nov. 19, 1863 of wounds received at the siege of Knoxville." Signed "O. M. Poe." Gen. Sanders was mortally on Nov. 18, 1863 and died the next morning. A salient earthen fort was named by Gen. Burnside, at Col. Poe's urging, for Sanders and became the key point in the repulse of Gen. Longstreet's Confederates on November 29, 1863.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sanders, William Price, 1833-1863
